subject: Gardening
title: What Triggers Germination
description: A short lesson to help you apply What Triggers Germination.

hook.text: A seed can sit in soil for years and refuse to sprout. It's waiting for a very specific set of conditions.

buildup.text: Most seeds need three things to germinate: water (to activate enzymes), oxygen (for respiration).

discovery.text: Water triggers gibberellin hormone release, signaling the embryo to produce enzymes that digest stored food.

twist.text: Some seeds demand extrasâ€”light, smoke chemicals, or cold periodsâ€”ensuring they sprout only when conditions suit.

climax.text: Germination isn't random. Seeds are programmed decision-makers, sprouting only when survival odds are highest.

punchline.text: Seeds don't just grow. They calculate when to grow.

quiz.question: What hormone does water trigger during seed germination?
options: Gibberellin, which activates enzymes to digest stored food
